item.title: 埃隆-马斯克就前推特员工离职问题进行的代价高昂、效率低下的斗争
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）将报道埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）为避免向被解雇的 Twitter 员工支付遣散费而进行的斗争。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner reports on Elon Musk’s battle to avoid severance payments to fired Twitter employees.】

item.title: 美国通胀回升迹象无处不在
item.description: 我是驻纽约的美国经济记者奥古斯塔-萨拉瓦。今天，我们关注美国的通货膨胀。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Augusta Saraiva, a US economy reporter in New York. item.title: 纳瓦罗称特朗普对推出关税的态度 "相当明确
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）让世界各地的投资者和贸易官员挠头不已，不知道他威胁的关税何时生效，范围有多大。他的一位高级贸易顾问不同意这种说法，认为这增加了困惑。【原文：President Donald Trump left investors and trade officials around the world scratching their heads about when his threatened tariffs will take effect and how broad they’ll be. One of his top trade advisers disagreed that there was added confusion.】

item.title: 欧尔班减税政策受挫，匈牙利将再次错失欧盟预算目标
item.description: 上周末，匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）宣布了选举前的减税措施，此后，匈牙利又面临着一系列预算目标未能实现的问题。【原文：Hungary is facing the latest in a series of missed budget targets after the announcement of pre-election tax breaks by Prime Minister Viktor Orban last weekend.】

item.title: 刚果在停止钴出口后将实施手工钴垄断
item.description: 刚果民主共和国正在开始实施一项计划已久的国家垄断措施，以控制手工开采的钴的生产，扩大其通过利用该国对全球供应的主导地位来提高电池金属价格的努力。【原文：Democratic Republic of Congo is starting to enforce a long-planned state monopoly to control production of hand-dug cobalt, broadening its efforts to boost prices for the battery metal by leveraging the country’s dominance over global supplies.】

item.title: 南非私人投资公司将非洲私人信贷视为机遇
item.description: 南非最大的资金管理公司将私人信贷视为非洲的一个增长机会，因为该公司寻求在本土市场之外实现多元化。【原文：South Africa’s biggest money manager sees private credit as a growth opportunity in Africa as it seeks to diversify outside of its home market.】

item.title: 投资反弹照亮波兰 2025 年经济前景
item.description: 波兰的经济前景因 2024 年末投资反弹的数据而得到提振，这表明该国 2025 年的经济增长除消费外可能还有另一个引擎。【原文：Poland’s economic prospects were boosted by data showing that investments rebounded in late 2024, suggesting that the country’s growth in 2025 may have another engine besides consumption.】

item.title: 自动化仓库推广放缓，Ocado 将裁员 500 人
item.description: Ocado Group Plc 将裁员约 500 人，约占其全球员工总数的 2.5%，因为其自动化杂货仓库业务的前景充满挑战。【原文：Ocado Group Plc will cut about 500 jobs, or about 2.5% of its global workforce, as it faces a challenging outlook for its automated grocery warehouse business.】

item.title: 美国国债下跌，交易商等待 GDP 数据释放增长信号
item.description: 交易员们在等待美国的经济数据，以寻找经济增长放缓的进一步迹象。【原文：Treasuries slipped as traders awaited economic data from the US for further signs that growth is flagging.】

item.title: 法拉利股权出售推动欧洲大宗交易创 20 年新高
item.description: 阿涅利家族出售了法拉利公司 30 亿欧元（31.4 亿美元）的股份，推动欧洲整车销售创下二十年来最强劲的开局。【原文：The Agnelli family’s disposal of a €3 billion ($3.14 billion) stake in Ferrari NV has propelled European block sales to the strongest start to the year in two decades.】

item.title: 美国抢购供应，主要鸡蛋运输国土耳其将对出口征税
item.description: 土耳其是世界上最大的鸡蛋运输国之一，在禽流感爆发挤压全球市场供应的情况下，土耳其开始征收出口税，以帮助控制国内价格。【原文：Turkey — one of the world’s biggest egg shippers — introduced a tax on exports to help control domestic prices, as bird flu outbreaks squeeze supply on the global market.】

item.title: 资本市场走强，加拿大帝国商业银行利润超出预期
item.description: 加拿大帝国商业银行（Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce）的业绩超出了分析师的预期，所有业务部门都取得了增长，尤其是资本市场业务表现强劲。【原文：Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce came ahead of analyst expectations with gains across all segments, particularly with strength in the capital markets business.】

item.title: 游说者敦促美国制裁犯错的南非官员
item.description: 自称代表南非白人利益的南非游说团体敦促特朗普政府谴责卷入国家贪污司法调查的南非最大政党的高级成员。【原文：South African lobby groups who say they represent the interests of White Afrikaners urged the Trump administration to censure senior members of the nation’s biggest political party implicated in a judicial probe into state graft.】

item.title: 小盘股阴霾从华尔街蔓延至董事会会议室
item.description: 小盘股公司的投资者情绪比几个月来更糟。事实证明，这些公司董事会内部的情绪也没好到哪里去。【原文：Investor sentiment around small-cap companies is worse than it’s been in months. As it turns out, the mood isn’t much better inside their corporate boardrooms.】

item.title: 买加拿大，再见美国特朗普的嘲讽激起了北方的愤怒
item.description:
由于 85% 的加拿大人在寻找美国商品的替代品，杂货店正在向消费者推广自产农产品。【原文：

Grocery stores are promoting homegrown produce to consumers as 85% of Canadians hunt for alternatives to US goods.

】

item.title: 从鸡蛋价格到住房，美国通胀再度升温
item.description: 无论从哪个指标来看，美国通胀都再次朝着错误的方向发展。【原文：No matter what metric you’re looking at, US inflation is moving in the wrong direction again.】

item.title: 亚马逊云计算部门打造名为 "Ocelot "的量子计算芯片
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的云计算部门制造出了首款量子计算芯片，加入了越来越多展示未来主义硬件的科技公司的行列。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud unit has built its first quantum-computing chip, joining a growing roster of technology companies showing off futuristic hardware.】

item.title: 反诽谤联盟推出据称是首个犹太人 ETF
item.description: 两个著名的犹太团体正在启动他们所说的有史以来第一个交易所交易基金，该基金将根据 S&P 500 指数公司是否对犹太事业友好来调整对这些公司的投资。【原文：Two prominent Jewish groups are starting what they say is the first-ever exchange-traded fund that will tailor investments in S&P 500 Index companies depending on whether they’re friendly to Jewish causes.】

item.title: 欧元反驳关税言论，创特朗普上台以来最低走势
item.description: 尽管唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统表示美国的贸易限制措施将波及欧洲，但欧元仍在其就职以来的最窄区间内交投，这表明市场对关税威胁已经感到疲劳。【原文：The euro is trading in the tightest range since President Donald Trump’s inauguration despite his comments that US trade restrictions are coming to Europe, a sign of market fatigue around tariff threats.】

item.title: 肯尼亚将利用新欧洲债券的收益重新安排债务
item.description: 肯尼亚财政部长约翰-姆巴迪（John Mbadi）表示，肯尼亚将把出售 15 亿美元欧元债券的全部收益用于重新安排国家债务，换出较短期的证券并偿还银团贷款。【原文：Kenya will use all of the proceeds from its $1.5 billion eurobond sale to re-arrange state debt by swapping out of shorter-dated securities and repaying syndicated loans, Treasury Secretary John Mbadi said.】

item.title: 高管情绪低落，小盘股阴霾加深
item.description: 小盘股公司的投资者情绪比几个月来更糟。事实证明，这些公司董事会内部的情绪也没好到哪里去。【原文：Investor sentiment around small-cap companies is worse than it’s been in months. As it turns out, the mood isn’t much better inside their corporate boardrooms.】

item.title: 日产、Seven & I 交易的余波使日本公司处于弱势
item.description: 这似乎是一次非凡的爱国主义和团结精神的展示：无论是濒临破产的汽车制造商日产汽车公司，还是陷入困境的便利店巨头 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：It seemed like an extraordinary display of patriotism and unity: Japan’s biggest companies would come together to save their own, whether ailing carmaker Nissan Motor Co. or besieged convenience store giant Seven & i Holdings Co.】

item.title: 中国电池企业杉杉将进入法院主导的重组程序
item.description: 中国法院受理了锂离子电池制造商杉杉集团股份有限公司的重组案，这是中国越来越多由法院主导的债务计划之一。【原文：A Chinese court accepted a restructuring for lithium-ion battery maker Shanshan Group Co., in one of a growing number of court-led debt plans in the country.】

item.title: 越南国家银行誓言保持利率稳定以促进经济增长
item.description: 越南央行今年将致力于保持利率稳定，以帮助企业和促进经济发展，因为这个东南亚国家今年的宏伟目标是实现至少 8%的经济增长。【原文：Vietnam’s central bank will aim to keep interest rates stable this year in a bid to help businesses and boost the economy, as the Southeast Asian nation targets an ambitious goal of at least 8% growth this year.】

item.title: 英国养老金以环境、社会和公司治理为由向 Amundi 和 Invesco 转移 280 亿英镑
item.description: 英国养老金主信托基金 "人民养老金"（People's Pension）授予 Amundi SA 和 Invesco Ltd. 两项任务，总额达 280 亿英镑（355 亿美元），理由是它们具有可持续性和负责任的投资资质。【原文：UK pension master trust the People’s Pension has awarded two mandates totaling £28 billion ($35.5 billion) to Amundi SA and Invesco Ltd., citing their sustainability and responsible investment credentials.】

item.title: 阿涅利家族出售 30 亿欧元法拉利股份，为 M&A 交易提供资金
item.description: 阿涅利家族出售了 30 亿欧元（31.4 亿美元）的法拉利股份，为其所谓的 "大规模新收购 "和股票回购提供资金。【原文：The Agnelli family sold a €3 billion ($3.14 billion) stake in Ferrari NV to fund what it calls a “sizeable new acquisition” and stock buyback.】

item.title: 规则迫使改变投资组合，土耳其货币市场基金规模缩水
item.description: 土耳其货币市场基金管理的资产减少，业绩下滑，因为要求这些基金在投资组合中至少有 10% 持有以里拉计价的政府债券的最后期限临近。【原文：Turkish money-market funds have seen assets under management decline and performance drop as a deadline approaches for them have at least 10% of their portfolios in lira-denominated government bonds.】

item.title: 特朗普关税在即，印度考虑削减汽车和化学品关税
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度官员正在探讨如何降低包括汽车和化学品在内的多种进口产品的关税，以规避美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁的对等征税。【原文：Indian officials are exploring ways to lower tariffs on a wide range of imports, including cars and chemicals, in a bid to evade US President Donald Trump’s threatened reciprocal levies, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通的 Benhamou 认为美国股市在春季反弹前受阻
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：US stocks will struggle early March amid weaker economic data before they rally once again later in spring, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Ilan Benhamou.】

item.title: 加纳宣布迫使埃尼公司与当地生产商合并油田的命令无效
item.description: 加纳正在撤销一项要求埃尼公司（Eni SpA）将其近海油田与当地一家生产商发现的油田合并的指令，从而有可能解决长达五年的僵局。【原文：Ghana is withdrawing a directive requiring Eni SpA to merge its offshore oil field with a discovery made by a local producer, potentially settling a five-year standoff.】
